description: This homemade Pizza Dough recipe is fool-proof and makes the best pizza in the oven, air fryer, pizza oven, or on the grill.
ingredients: [{"name": "active dry yeast", "units": "teaspoons", "amount": "2 1/4"}, {"name": "granulated sugar", "units": "teaspoons", "amount": "2"}, {"name": "warm water", "units": "cups", "amount": "1 1/2"}, {"name": "olive oil", "units": "Tablespoons", "amount": "3"}, {"name": "salt", "units": "teaspoons", "amount": "1 1/2"}, {"name": "white vinegar", "units": "teaspoon", "amount": "1"}, {"name": "bread flour", "units": "cups", "amount": "3 3/4-4"}]
instructions: Combine ½ cup of the warm water with the sugar and yeast. Stir to dissolve the yeast then let rest for 5 minutes. Add the remaining warm water, olive oil, salt, and vinegar. Gradually add flour and knead for about 7 minutes. Allow to rise for 1 to 1.5 hours. Divide dough and roll out to desired size. Preheat oven to 450°F and pre-bake for 3-4 minutes. Add toppings and bake for 8-15 more minutes.
nutrition_info: Calories: 424 kcal, Carbohydrates: 70 g, Protein: 12 g, Fat: 10 g, Saturated Fat: 1 g, Sodium: 704 mg, Fiber: 3 g, Sugar: 2 g.
notes: You can make the dough ahead and refrigerate or freeze it for later use.
